intro: Saccus zollingerianus, commonly known as the Zollinger's sac, is a rare and specialized plant found in specific alpine environments. It belongs to the family Apiaceae and is characterized by its unique, sac-like structure that houses its reproductive organs. The plant's morphology includes slender, hairy stems and small, clustered leaves. It thrives in high-altitude regions with cool, moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
